# Introduction

This document is a test/exercise to run <b>R</b> and <b>Python </b> code in the <b>same</b> Quarto file. 

I will perform linear regressions using data from [Body Fat Data](https://hbiostat.org/data/) that is found in the book [Regression Modeling Strategies](https://hbiostat.org/rmsc/) by [Frank E Harrell Jr](https://hbiostat.org/)


Install and load packages
```{r}
# Install and load packages

# First check if pacman is installed
if (!requireNamespace("pacman", quietly = TRUE)) {
    message("ðŸ“¦ 'pacman' not found â€” installing...")
    install.packages("pacman")
  }


pacman::p_load(
  reticulate, # Allows working with Python inside R
  readr,
  here, # relative file pathways 
  tidyverse # data management and visualization
  )


```


Load the Data
```{r}
# Load data 
df <- read_csv(here("Input", "Data", "bodyfat.csv"))
summary(df)
```

# Linear Regression model using **R**
```{r}
lm_r <- lm(Height ~ Age + Wrist + Knee + Ankle, data = df)
summary(lm_r)
```
